title: The Itch Behind the Eyes

panel_structure.description: The Architect's head showing visible irritation, hand reaching to scratch, but the itch is clearly deeper than skin—glowing beneath the skull
X-ray view revealing the itch as swirling knowledge behind the eyes, patterns of 'what you are' that can be felt but never fully grasped or verbalized
Cycles of forgetting and remembering visualized as waves—the itch disappearing only to return stronger, each cycle deepening the felt understanding

transformation_notes: The itch becomes a perfect metaphor for existential knowledge—always present but never fully scratchable, meant to be felt rather than explained, lost and found in endless cycles.
